description:
Overview
 Easton Consulting Technologies, LLC is a global Proprietary Consulting Firm helping to launch various successful Prop Firms servicing retail traders worldwide. We seek to immediately bring on a Junior Web Developer eager to leverage and refine their intellectual curiosity and problem-solving skills on a global scale. As a Junior Web Developer, you will be responsible for assisting in the development and maintenance of our company's websites and web applications. You will work closely with our senior developers and other team members to ensure that all projects are completed on time and to the highest standard. Our ideal candidate will be passionate about applying their skills to a FinTech-based business model that helps create income opportunities for traders worldwide.
 Responsibilities
 Summary
 Your primary responsibilities will include collaborating with other developers to implement new features, writing clean and efficient code, debugging and troubleshooting issues, and testing website functionality. You will also be expected to participate in code reviews and contribute to the overall development process. Additionally, you may be tasked with researching and recommending new technologies to improve the company's web presence. Strong communication and teamwork skills are essential, as you will be working closely with other developers and cross-functional teams.
 Detailed Responsibilities

Assisting in the development of our company's website and web applications
Writing clean and well-structured code
Testing and debugging code to ensure that it meets the required standards
Collaborating with senior developers and designers to ensure that all projects are completed on time and to the highest standard
Learning and utilizing new technologies to improve the quality of our company's products
Maintaining and updating existing codebases as needed
Contributing to technical documentation as needed
Assists with website maintenance tasks, such as troubleshooting issues and deploying updates.

Qualifications & Skills
 Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
Strong understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP
Familiarity with AWS, WordPress, and Cloudflare
Experience with AWS CodeCommit
Excellent communication and teamwork skills
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Passion for web development and staying up-to-date with the latest technologies and industry trends
Demonstrated ability to write clean, efficient code using best practices

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with RESTful APIs and third-party integrations
Familiarity with database design and management
Understanding of responsive design and mobile-first development
Experience with Agile development methodologies
Experience working in FinTech, Financial Services, Retail Trading, and/or Prop Firms a plus

Desired Technical Skills

Proficiency in web development technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP
Experience working with WordPress and developing custom WordPress themes and plugins
Familiarity with AWS services, including EC2, S3, RDS, and CloudFront
Understanding of Cloudflare services, including CDN, DNS, and security features
Knowledge of database management systems, such as MySQL and MongoDB
Understanding of version control systems, such as AWS CodeCommit
Experience with web performance optimization and page speed techniques
Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and tools such as Jira and ClickUp
Knowledge of web security best practices and techniques for protecting against common threats, such as SQL injection and cross-site scripting (XSS)

Role Requirements
 Location: Remote - US-Based
 Start Date: Immediately
 Schedule: Our core salaried team is online 8 am - 5 pm EST with a 1-hour lunch break.
 Benefits
 This role is a full-time W2 position and comes with the following company benefits:

Health Insurance:

 99% coverage on medical, dental, vision
 
Paid Time Off:

14 days paid Vacation
14 days of paid Sick leave
3 Personal days
2 Floating Holidays
6 Company Holidays
     
Memorial Day
Independence Day
Labor Day
Thanksgiving
Christmas Day
New Years Day

The Challenge:
 Are you looking for an opportunity to combine your technical skills with big picture thinking to make a mission impact to support the warfighter? You understand your customer’s environment and how to develop the right systems for their mission. Your ability to translate real-world needs into technical specifications, makes you an integral part of delivering a customer focused engineering solution.

 As a systems engineer on our team, you have the chance to design cloud based software systems in support of national space. Your technical expertise will be vital as you evaluate and modernize data processing in the cloud. You’ll develop your skills in software system support while gaining experience in mission data transformation meeting data centricity objectives. Grow your skills by merging system processes and documentation with strategic growth and risk management to create efficient, dependable software products. Join our team and help turn requirements into accomplishments that drive change.

 Empower change with us.

 You Have:

 Experience with systems engineering or software development life cycle (SDLC)
 Experience with Agile methodology, requirements definition, Scrum, Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL) creation, editing and delivery, system documentation, or customer support
 Ability to support missions through detailed, well written, and government accepted documentation and requirements traceability
 Ability to identify and track technical debt, risks, and opportunities at a tactical and strategic level
 Ability to function on a team and fully engage in Agile planning and support
 TS/SCI clearance
 Bachelor’s degree
 Ability to obtain Security+ CE, SSCP, CCNA-Security, or GSEC Certification within 6 months of hire


 Nice If You Have:

 Experience with cloud software development, requirements traceability, Government Contract Data Requirements Lists (CDRLs), Risk Management Processes or best practices, or software backend testing
 Knowledge of Atlassian tools, including Jira and Confluence, and Visio graphic design
 Ability to deliver documentation on time through the Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL) approval process, including a sense of teamwork and helping to bring the next level of value added to taskings
 Possession of excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
 Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills
 TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph
 Security+ CE, SSCP, CCNA-Security, or GSEC Certification 


Clearance:
 Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

 Build Your Career:
 A challenging and dynamic work environment isn’t all we have to offer. When you join Booz Allen, you’ll have access to:

 experts in virtually every field
 a culture that focuses on supporting our employees
 opportunities that provide stability while offering variety


 You’ll also be exposed to a wealth of training resources through our Digital University, an online learning portal featuring more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications that directly impact your role? You may be able to take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site bootcamps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success. 

Compensation
 At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.
 Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $52,100.00 to $119,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees.
 
 Work Model Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.

 If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
 If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.


 EEO Commitment
 We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

Riverside Research is an independent National Security Nonprofit dedicated to research and development in the national interest. We provide high-end technical services, research and development, and prototype solutions to some of the country's most challenging technical problems.
  


 Job Number: 1154
 Riverside Research is seeking a Junior-Level Software Engineer to support the Air Force Research Laboratory research and development efforts. As a key member of Riverside Research, the Junior-Level Software Engineer will work closely with the Government customer to implement state-of the-art open architecture (OA) mission capabilities.
 The chosen candidate will serve as a junior-level technical member of a team consisting of software engineers, and researchers to develop and demonstrate technology and advanced component prototype solutions to evolve and expand emerging OA standards and approaches for current and next-generation Air Force and DoD weapon systems. The engineer will provide mature, robust open architecture solutions to rapidly integrate mission systems, facilitate mission system capability evolution, as well as sustained competition across the system life cycle.
 All Riverside Research opportunities require U.S. Citizenship.
 Job Responsibilities:

Develop high quality C++ and Java applications
Implement unit, functional, regression, and acceptance tests
Containerize existing applications
Analyze, document, and present tests and their results
Other duties as assigned

Required Qualifications:

Ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI security clearance
Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or other related STEM degree
Experience with C++ or Java programming languages
Experience with source control (Git)
Experience with Visual Studio, GCC, GDB, and XML

Desired Qualifications:

Active TS/SCI security clearance
Experience with Docker/containerization
Experience with Kubernetes
Experience with Data Distribution Services (DDS)
Experience developing and refining Open Architecture standards
Familiarity to working with serial interfaces, analog and digital I/O, TCP/IP, and avionic buses such as 1553 and ARINC 429/615/629/717




 Riverside Research does not mandate COVID vaccination as a condition of employment. However, proof of vaccination or negative test may be required to enter certain government facilities and sites. Vaccination requirements will depend on the status of the federal contractor mandate and customer site-specific requirements. To protect the health and safety of its employees, their families, and to comply with customer requirements, the company requires all employees to disclose vaccination status (upon hire).
 Riverside Research strives to be one of America's premier providers of independent, trusted technical and scientific expertise. We continue to add experienced and technically astute staff who are highly motivated to help our DoD and Intelligence Community (IC) customers deliver world class programs. As a not-for-profit, technology-oriented defense company, we believe service to customers and support of our staff is our mission. Our goal is to serve as a destination company by providing an industry-leading, positive, and rewarding employee experience for all who join us. We aspire to be a valued partner to our customers and to earn their trust through our unwavering commitment to achieve timely, innovative, cost-effective and mission-focused solutions.
 All positions at Riverside Research are subject to background investigations. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a background investigation including criminal history and identity check.
 Our EEO Policy Riverside Research is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, employ, train, compensate and promote without regard to race, religion, sex, color, national origin, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, disability/veteran, status as a protected veteran, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state and local law.
 If you need assistance at any time in our application or interview process, please contact Recruiting at email Recruiting@RiversideResearch.org. A member of the Recruiting team will be available to assist.
 This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-741.5(a). This regulation prohibits discrimination against qualified individuals on the basis of disability and requires affirmative action by covered prime contractors and subcontractors to employ and advance in employment qualified individuals with disabilities.
 This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-300.5(a). This regulation prohibits discrimination against qualified protected veterans and requires affirmative action by covered contractors and subcontractors to employ and advance in employment qualified protected veterans.
 For more information on "EEO is the Law," please visit: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf
 https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf

If you are a Jr. PHP Developer with experience, please read on! Located in Tampa, Fl. we are the software division of the Fest Corporation Family of Companies which include American Marketing and Mailing and American Visual Brands.
 Top Reasons to Work with Us
 You get to work with other top talent Developers who value the same principles as you do. We encourage learning new techniques, sharing your knowledge with others and invest in the training to get you to the next level. We’re an equal opportunity employer providing a fun but respectful environment to work in. We strive to make your role both challenging and rewarding.
 What You Will Be Doing
 The role is for a Senior Developer to help lead the Web Team into the next generation of web content delivery. We’re looking for someone with experience with multiple frameworks and languages who can quickly learn and understand our code base, help identify architecture and performance improvements, and can drive a transition plan to get there while continuing to improve our user experience.
 What You Need for this Position
 Experience: 1+ yrs PHP software development With the following languages/frameworks: PHP/ Symfony, Javascript, CSS, HTML
 What’s In It for You
 For your hard work we are offering a competitive salary benefits and vacation! Dress is Jeans casual with periodic employee team building activities. So, if you are a Jr. PHP Developer with experience, please apply today!
 Applicants must be local applicants authorized to work in the U.S.

SimVentions, consistently voted one Virginia's Best Places to Work, is looking for a Jr. or Mid-level software developer to join our team! This individual will be tasked with a goal of becoming proficient in all aspects of tactical system development, including design and programming of tactical program, simulator, and data analysis tool(s); root-cause and performance data analysis, document development, community interaction. This ideal candidates will grow into the replacement for retiring senior team members.
 Responsibilities:

Proactively blend with a small contractor/government software development team
Perform assigned programming tasks in C++ and Java
Follow established development processes and procedures; recommend improvements
Be ready to learn and to teach (processes are not up to current standards)

 Required Skills & Experience:
 Jr. developer needs only to be ready to learn. Mid-level developer needs to have proficiency in C++ and/or Java, and a background in real or near-real time system programming (not website development).
Additional Requirements:

Due to the requirements in the Safer Federal Workforce Taskforce guidance and the nature of our covered contracts and facilities, all employees may need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have a legal exemption with approved accommodation. 

Preferred Skills & Experience:
 Real-time or near real-time systems development; experience in combat system development; cyber security or Machine Learning or AI is a plus 
Education:
 BS Degree from ABET recognized engineering curriculum. Examples include: Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science OR BS Degree in physical science, engineering, or mathematics that includes 24 semester hours in physical science or other relevant coursework.
 Minimum Clearance: Ability to obtain a Secret Clearance. (U.S. Citizenship required.)
 Travel (if applicable): Some (Need grows with experience)
 Location: On Site at Dahlgren Virginia (SEATED ON BASE)
 Why Work for SimVentions?
 SimVentions is about more than just being a place to work with other growth-orientated technically exceptional experts. It’s also a fun place to work. Our family-friendly atmosphere encourages our employee-owners to imagine, create, explore, discover, and do great things together.
 Support Our Warfighters
 SimVentions is a proud supporter of the U.S. military, and we take pride in our ability to provide relevant, game-changing solutions to our armed men and women around the world.
 Drive Customer Success
 We deliver innovative products and solutions that go beyond the expected. This means you can expect to work with a team that will allow you to grow, have a voice, and make an impact.  Get Involved in Giving Back
 We believe that one of the best ways to be a well-rounded company is to have well-rounded employees, and one of the ways we encourage that is by providing a wide range of service opportunities for our team members to engage in throughout the year.
 Build Innovative Technology
 SimVentions takes pride in its innovative and cutting-edge technology, so you can be sure that whatever project you work on, you will be having a direct impact on our customer’s success.
 Work with Brilliant People
 At SimVentions, we don’t just hire the smartest people. We hire experienced, creative individuals who are passionate about what they do, and who benefit from the culture that we have created here.
 Create Meaningful Solutions
 We are trusted partners with our customers and are provided challenging and meaningful requirements to help them solve.
 Employees who join SimVentions will enjoy benefits like:

Impact: work on projects that directly support the defense of our nation.
Serve: work for a company that supports its surrounding communities.
Employee Owned: work with the best and help build YOUR company.
Dress code: business casual. We like to be comfortable while we work.
Healthcare: one of the best packages in the industry.
Culture: add to our culture of technical excellence and collaboration.
Food: we have a lot of food around here.
Family focus: work for a team that recognizes the importance of family time.
Resources: excellent facilities, tools, and training opportunities to grow in your field.
Open communication: work in an environment where your voice matters.
Fitness/Well-being: opportunities to participate in company sports teams and workout groups.
Professional development: employee-led interest groups for personal and professional development plus great training options
What you bring to the table: contribute, grow, and thrive.

Other Perks:

Lots of employee appreciation events throughout the year
Excellent working facilities and tools to get your job done
Regular communication (“All-Hands”, “SimV Share”, “Imagineering Day”) to stay connected to SimV culture, stay abreast of what is happening in the company, and meet new faces while eating good food
SimVentions sports teams and workout groups
Employee led interest groups for personal and professional development
What you bring to the table…

FTAC

 Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
 The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

We are looking for a Junior Software Developer to join our Calabasas, CA offices (Los Angeles County). This position requires excellent communication and organization skills, intellectual curiosity, a passion for teamwork and a self-starter mindset. Interest in Real Estate, Business Intelligence, Analytics, Data Warehousing and Financial Reporting is a plus.
You have 1+ years of development experience that includes website development, CSS and at least one of the following programming languages( JavaScript C# or VB.NET) You don’t need all three, and what you don’t know, we will train you.
The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate that they:1. Know at least one Programming Language (JavaScript or C# or VB.NET)2. Know HTML3. Know AngularJS4. Have a basic understanding of SQL and Databases in General
If you are the kind of person who gets excited by:

Working with large data sets and writing code that helps users understand that data.
Understanding, developing, testing and debugging complex systems and applications
Investigating and identifying the root cause of defects, hands-on

Then this position might be for you.
Essential Functions Include:

Work holistically as part of a balanced team of software engineers, client relationship managers, sales and support
Help solving problems with software, across a vast spectrum of complexity, language and framework types
Collaborate with other members of your team to design the best and simplest solution possible and work together to overcome any challenges along the way
Enjoy full stack development and ability to pivot from project to project
Work on both new, and rewriting or re-factoring of existing business logic
Continuously learn, be self-directed and a self-starter

Education/Qualifications: BA/BS or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent industry experience is strongly preferred

1+ years of development experience
US work authorization (Required)
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Good time management, ability to multi-task and participate in team work

Compensation/Benefits: Job Type: Full Time

Compensation: $25/hour and up (depending on experience)
Annual performance-related bonus

About the Company: Datex Property Solutions is a leader in business intelligence software for Real Estate portfolio owners. Real Estate is the single biggest asset class on the planet, and yet the industry is too often run by gut and hunch. We deliver a Software-as-a-Service solution (SaaS) that enables our clients to leverage the data that they already have to realize 100% Better Operations. It’s market proven, and we are a recognized leader with lots of big name clients.Miscellaneous

Datex Property Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to diversity
To protect our candidates and Datex employees during the Covid-19 outbreak, all interviews will take place remotely
Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster.
Do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offers

Job Type: Full-time
Pay: From $48,750.00 per year
Benefits:

Paid time off

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Supplemental pay types:

Bonus pay

Ability to commute/relocate:

Calabasas, CA 91302: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Education:

Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

JavaScript: 1 year (Required)
C#: 1 year (Required)
VB.NET: 1 year (Required)
Website development: 1 year (Required)
CSS: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

job_title: Jr-Mid Level Data Engineer/Analyst with Front-end experience
description:
- Gather and create business requirements, understand client needs and communicate those needs internally and
externally.
- Gauge development size and timeline ranking projects/features/enhancements from S, M, L, XL, XXL. These were
backed by data (research) and were used by the business to determine which projects took priority, as well as
internally to apply necessary human resources to those projects.
- Utilize SQL to create/configure products based on requirements from the business partners
- Resolved application defects tracked in Jira. Analysis includes troubleshooting SQL, Perl, Java, and some Angular.
Actual code fixes pertain to SQL and Perl, including complex SQL update statements across multiple tables /
environments, and Perl ternary operators and statements.
- Consolidate hierarchal data structures into readable tabular data via SQL.
- Cleaned MySQL databases. Fixed bad data and poorly constructed tables, improved structure and readability of
stored procedures and admin scripts.
- Loaded via SQL inserts > 5 million distinct prices for dental and vision plans derived from incomplete data,
requiring complex update statements to be applied to the records for employer paid plans. Multiple criteria such
as risk class, group size, region (zip code), coverage level, etc. were factors in applying these updates.
- Collaborated with other developers and expanded SQL scripts repository in Bitbucket via GIT to track changes.
- Successfully implemented many plan introductions for states across the country, in addition to global features and
enhancements that apply to the products.
- Supported overnight deployments for updates that included all developers’ code changes over a given release
cycle, fixing any production support issues that arose in a timely manner.
HR requirements-

Minimum of 4 years’ experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or programming
PERM, Remote role, 80k max salary

Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year
Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance

Experience level:

4 years

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Work Location: RemoteHealth insurance

ABOUT US:
 Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.


 JOB TYPE: Direct Hire Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
LOCATION: Remote - United States only
SALARY: $110,000 – $125,000/yr
ESTIMATED DURATION: 40hr/week - Long term


 ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:
 When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.

 THE OPPORTUNITY
 Requirements

USA candidates only and must be US Citizens
1-3 years of software engineering experience
Must have experience working with Javascript framework, Node JS, React, SQL and SQL Server.
Nice to have experience with .NET
Very strong communicator who desires to collaborate and work with teammates, as opposed to working in a silo.
Relational database design, optimization, and administration
Ability to take a calm, cool and collected approach to projects and challenges.

What you’ll be working on
 DMI Software, the San Francisco branch of Dovenmuehle Mortgage, Inc, the leading sub-servicer of mortgage loans in the United States, is looking for a talented and enthusiastic Senior Software Engineer. We work exclusively in Software Development. Our growing office offers the feel of a startup with the backing and security of a long-established company.

 You are:

 A developer looking to make their mark on an office that is quickly coming into its own.
Able to meaningfully collaborate with designers to translate stakeholder asks into sleek, intuitive solutions.
Excited to work on a broad range of projects from inception to release.
Always looking for ways to improve processes and make work easier for everyone.
Hawkish about quality assurance and data protection.
Mindful of maintaining brand integrity across multiple internally and externally-facing applications.
Accustomed to delivering polished products on schedule.
Insatiably curious about emerging tech and evolving approaches.
Happy to lend your wisdom and experience to more junior engineers.
Able to develop fruitful rapports with stakeholders and technical staff near and far.
Capable of identifying blockers long before they are an issue.
A strong communicator


 Salary + Bonus and Excellent Benefits
 Apply Now!

 Braintrust Job ID: 6150

 C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

 Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

 This is a remote position.

Atlanta, GA (Hybrid- LOCAL): Jr. .Net Developer ($20K-$50K)
⁃ Application deadline 03/28/2023, first come first serve
⁃ Salary with medical, dental, vision insurance

Job Description:
The Information Technology Division is seeking candidates for a Junior .NET Developer position. In this role, the successful applicant will be responsible for development and application support over payment processing and in-line related applications.

• The Information Technology Division is seeking candidates for a Junior .NET Developer position. In this role, the successful applicant will be responsible for development and application support over payment processing and in-line related applications. The successful candidate will perform requirements gathering and analysis, application development and support, software debugging and application testing, and preparation of implementation specifications.


• The candidate will work a hybrid work schedule (primarily telework with on-site day(s) required as directed by the agency. The candidate’s on-site day could be from Southmeadow (4125 Welcome All Rd.) or Century Center (1800 Century Blvd. NE) locations as needed by the agency.

Job Responsibilities::
1. Design, code, test, modify, install, and debug software applications that integrate with Revenue payment processing systems and in-line related systems.
2. Research and analyze system problems with a team or individual, create solutions, and develop program documentation.
3. Translate business requirements into development tasks for secure and maintainable code.
4. Communicate to business users the required information on business inquiries.
5. Perform daily job functions to ensure complete and error–free processing of Revenue payment processing systems.
Qualification:

• Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with coursework in computer science, information technology or information system management.


• Minimum 0-3 years’ experience of object-oriented development within the system development life cycle with experience coding in the Microsoft .Net Framework. (C#, VB, ASP.net, MVC, JavaScript) using Microsoft Visual Studio.


• Minimum 0-3 years’ experience with SQL server and Oracle databases with familiarity with using SQL, PL/SQL, or T-SQL.


• Familiarity of software development methodologies, standards, coding best practices and general debugging procedures.


• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to take initiative.


• Team player with excellent communication skills.

Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $20,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year
Schedule:

8 hour shift

Atlanta, GA 30303: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Experience with ORM tools (Entity Framework, NHibernate, Dapper)

Skilled in unit and integration testing and results validation


Experience working within an Agile/Scrum Framework and its application in product development and delivery


Experience utilizing Agile code management tools (e.g., Azure DevOps)


Experience supporting production applications


Experience working with the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)

Strong problem- determination skills and resolution experience.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related analytical field or equivalent experience Special Qualifications:

 Description of Duties:
The Junior Release Manager supports the Missile Defense Agency (MDA) on the Integrated Research and Development for Enterprise Solutions (IRES) contract. The candidate will:



Maintain the library of RDM models, ensures proper planning, scheduling, and control of the build, test, and deployment of project releases based on ITIL best practices in the Enterprise environment. 
Work with stakeholders ensuring they are aware of and agree with planned deployments, provides traceability as services are transitioned into production. 
Work alongside with other Release and Deployment Managers, Change Coordinators, Configuration Management and Evaluation, Validation and Test Engineers. 
On call for maintenance windows to support GNOSC.



This position can be filled at Schriever SFB, Colorado Springs, CO or Redstone Arsenal, Huntsville, AL


This position is expected to pay $71,000 - $81,000 annually; depending on experience, education, and any certifications that are directly related to the position.


This position will be posted for a minimum of 3 days. If a candidate has not been selected at that time, it will continue to be posted until a suitable candidate is selected or the position is closed.


Resumes, in month and year format, must be submitted with application in order to be considered for the position. The selected candidate will be assigned as an employee for Jacobs or one of our teammate companies.

What about learning drives us to do more than deliver the lesson? Maybe we’re overachievers. Or maybe we just know what real impact looks like. Each one of us has seen passion win over fear, vision become relentless focus and belief in human potential make it all the way to the finish line.
 Our mission is to design new models for educational success and raise academic achievement for all learners Are you ready to find a career with a company whose mission, vision, and values align with yours? . Can you see yourself fitting into this mission with us?

       POSITION SUMMARY:
     

       As part of Arizona State University’s charter to provide access and excellence, ASU Preparatory Academy (ASU Prep) shares this commitment by demonstrating all students can achieve at the highest levels, regardless of their background. To scale our current impact, ASU Prep is advancing a major expansion program taking fundamental responsibility for the communities we serve.
     

 Are you ready to join a world class innovation team that is changing the landscape of education? Inspired and led by ASU’s charter, the ASU Prep Digital Product Team’s goal is to build learning experiences that significantly improve student performance and provide access to educational pathways that enable a better life. The full suite of next-generation courses on our roadmap will leverage adaptive technologies to meet students where they are with fully personalized learning and individualized pacing. Additionally, these courses will feature entirely custom experiential learning environments that are built leveraging the most engaging and immersive technologies to design a discovery-based, learner outcome-centered, approach. Drawing from ASU’s culture of innovation, the ASU Prep Digital Product team is creating the future of learning. The Junior Software Engineer is responsible for the production of scalable web-based applications and user interfaces.


 QUALIFICATIONS:
     



         Bachelor's Degree or equivalent training or experience in software development.
       


         One to two (1-2) years of proven working experience in a Web Developer role with active involvement throughout development
       


         Experience as a front-end web developer with capabilities on the back-end, front-end, deployment and maintenance of modern JavaScript based applications.
       


         Experience working with cross-disciplinary teams such as UX, Design, Operations, Product, etc.
       


         Any equivalent combination of experience, training and/or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities may be considered.
       



 DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
     



         Work with development teams and product managers to ideate software solutions.
       


         Work closely with Curriculum, UX, and engineering teams to ideate and implement front end solutions for K-12 learning.
       


         Design, develop, and manage automated unit, integration, and acceptance tests for all UI components.
       


         Ability to execute UI Design into working code.
       


         Produce workable, efficient code that meets technical specifications.
       


         Write and maintain documentation to describe program development, logic, coding, testing, and changes.
       


         Design, code, test, debug, document, and maintain software following the organization’s software development life cycle (SDLC) methodology.
       


         Formulate and define system scope and objectives through research and fact-finding to develop or modify moderately complex information systems.
       


         Responsible for software integration, external interface development and technical documentation.
       


         Follow detailed functional and technical specifications to configure/code enhancements and bug fixes.
       


         Additional duties may be assigned as necessary.
       



 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
     




 Comfortable working with, communicating and presenting to engineering leadership.
       


         Experience building modern front-end applications / UIs with JavaScript, HTML, CSS.
       


         Experience working with JavaScript, ES6+, React, Redux and Styled components.
       


         Familiarity with testing tools such as Cypress.
       


         Experience consuming RESTful APIs and OpenAPI Specifications.
       


         Experience with Git and Git services such as GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket.
       


         Excellent teamwork and organizational skills.
       


         Excellent verbal and written communication in addition to persuasively clear and concise presentation skills.
       


         Strong critical thinking skills with the ability to communicate ideas clearly to others.
       


         Demonstrated ability to meet quantitative and qualitative objectives.
       


         Exceptional self-management skills including the ability to handle diverse tasks simultaneous to meeting aggressive project timelines and producing high-quality results.
       


         Highly organized, detail-oriented and results-driven focus; highly responsive to feedback and collaboration.
       


         Knowledge of K-12 school setting a plus.
       



 PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
     

       The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
     


 While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand and talk or hear and sometimes walk and sit. The employee must use hands, arms and fingers to input data, handle, feel or reach. While performing the duties of this job, the employee may occasionally push or lift up to 15 lbs such as boxes, supplies, etc. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision such as to read handwritten or typed material, and the ability to adjust focus, close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision and depth perception.
     


 LOCATION:
     

       Remote
     


 TRAVEL:
     

       Occasional travel may be required for site visits, meetings, trainings and/or conferences. Locations may vary and may require overnight stays.

Elect Technology Management is currently seeking a talented Junior Programmer / Software Developer to join our team. This position includes assisting in the researching, designing, documenting, and modifying software specifications throughout the production lifecycle. This software developer work as part of an application development team and will also analyze and amend software errors in a timely and accurate fashion and provide status reports where required. This successful candidate will possess both the technical and team skills to facilitate the fulfillment of technical and business goals. The position is located in Greencastle, PA and comes with a full benefits package.
Responsibilities:

To design, code, test, and analyze software programs and applications for both business production and testing purposes
Work with senior developers to write, translate, and code software programs and applications according to established specifications.
Assist with planning phases of the software development life cycle (SDLC) for a variety of projects.
Assist senior developers, analysts, and designers in conceptualizing and developing new software programs and applications.
Conduct research on emerging application development software products, languages, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts.
Work cohesively as part of a valued team to accomplish business objectives, when appropriate serving as a liaison with network administrators, systems analysts, and software engineers to assist in resolving problems with software products or company software systems.

Requirements:

1 year of experience with .NET framework or equivalent education
1 year of experience with HTML JavaScript/jQuery or equivalent education
Knowledgeable on database fundamentals
Solid understanding of the application development design principles
Analytical and problem-solving abilities
Good written and oral communication skills

Preferred:

Ability to quickly learn new technologies and programming languages
Experience with Microsoft SQL

Preferred Education and Experience are as follows: An associate's degree in Information Systems and preferably 1 year of technical experience of application development, with a primary focus on Microsoft’s .NET framework and/or HTML JavaScript/jQuery. Will accept equivalent education if technical experience is less than 1 year.

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Under 1 year

Overview: 
 
 About Transdev: Cities, counties, airports, companies, and universities across the U.S. contract with Transdev to operate their transportation systems, maintain their vehicle and fleets, and deliver on mobility solutions. Transdev U.S. employs a team of 32,000 across 400 locations while maintaining more than 17,000 vehicles.
 

   Part of a global company, Transdev is a leader in mobility with operations in 19 countries, proudly operated by 110,000 team members from around the world. As an operator and global integrator of mobility, we are driven by our purpose. Transdev – the mobility company – empowers the freedom to move every day thank to safe, reliable, and innovative solutions that serve the common good. Find out more at www.TransdevNA.com or watch an overview video at https://youtu.be/ilO5cv0G4mQ
 


 Overview of Position:



 The Transdev Business Solutions Team is a diverse cross-functional team of IT and transit operational professionals. The team designs, develops, implements, supports, and optimizes the commercial and proprietary business technology solutions for Transdev operations. Focused on innovation and customer service we support the platforms and users that drive continued improvement in Transdev’s operations.
 


 Reporting to the Director of Software Development this position plays a key role in developing and supporting Transdev’s proprietary software systems. This position will combine strong technical ability, with good communication, curiosity and coachability.
 

 Responsibilities: 
 
 Key Responsibilities:


 


  Develop, support and maintain .Net windows/web applications with VB.net, C#, ASP.net, JavaScript with MS SQL, ORACLE backend. Write clean, scalable code using .NET Core programming languages focusing on web vb.net/JavaScript development in Visual Studio. Develop technical interfaces, specifications, and architecture. Web mapping integration with Google Maps in Visual Studio via .NET 3.x+ and JavaScript/API.
 

   Develop and implement web services in IIS (SOAP, REST).
 

 Coachable - Open to constructive criticism, with a strong desire to implement and sustain feedback by others.
 Curious - Actively seek information pertaining to our business, services and customer base.
 Willing to support critical duties - Support responsibilities that must continue to be performed during crisis situations and contingency operations.


 Qualifications: 
 
 Education, Licensing, and Certifications: 
 

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent direct job experience

 

Experience: 
 

Successful track record of developing quality software using .Net Core 3.x+.
 Strong knowledge on MS SQL environment.
 Experience with Windows Server and OS Virtualization platforms.
 Knowledge on the fundamentals of Windows Active Directory, SSO concepts
 Minimum 3 years of current software development experience. Professional experience building Microsoft Windows platform web applications using VB.net, C#, ASP.net, Javascript. 
Web mapping integration with Google Maps via Javascript/API.


 Skills and Knowledge Required:


 MS Tools (Excel, Outlook, Word, Teams, etc.).
 Team Foundation Server.
 Formats such as XML, JSON, etc.
 REST/SOAP.
 Solid grasp of Client/Server fundamentals and Browser/Server interaction and IIS.
 Creating .NET windows services under Visual Studio.
 MS SSRS/SSIS.
 Good knowledge of various Data Structures and Optimization techniques.
 Should have working experience with database engines like MS SQL Server 2012+, My SQL, Oracle.
 Create .NET web applications that utilize Google Maps for real-time information and/or historical analysis.

 Drug testing and background check
 Testing related to job requirements.
